      whether the view is currently not sorting

    • setPreventSorting

      public void setPreventSorting(boolean preventSorting)
      Description copied from interface: GridView
      Preventing sorting means that the changes will still arrive at the backing list and view list, but, the view list won't be resorted and if a resource is zeroed, will stay in view until sorting is enabled again. This still requires a call to GridView.sort() when preventing sorting is disabled again.
      Specified by:
      setPreventSorting in interface GridView<T>
      Parameters:
      preventSorting - whether the view should prevent sorting on changes

    • getSortingDirection

    • loadResource

      public void loadResource(T resource, long amount, StorageTracker.Entry trackerEntry)
      Description copied from interface: GridView
      Loads a resource in the backing list. The resource still won't be visible in the view list, call GridView.sort() for that.
      Specified by:
      loadResource in interface GridView<T>
      Parameters:
      resource - the resource
      amount - the amount
      trackerEntry - the tracker entry, can be null

    • sort

      public void sort()
      Description copied from interface: GridView
      Sorts the view list. Applies sorting and filtering rules.
      Specified by:

    • onChange

      public void onChange(T resource, long amount, StorageTracker.Entry trackerEntry)
      Description copied from interface: GridView
      Applies a change to a resource. Will update the backing list, and will also update the view list (depending if the view is preventing sorting).
      Specified by:
      onChange in interface GridView<T>
      Parameters:
      resource - the resource
      amount - the amount, can be negative or positive
      trackerEntry - the tracker entry, can be null
